title: Not Sure How Much You Should Be Paid? Colorado Could Offer Some Clues
sub_head: State law requires Amazon, Palantir, Walmart and others to disclose expected pay ranges— we sorted through more than 5,000 postings
body:
You don’t have to go to another job interview without knowing how much you can actually make.
People applying to jobs at big companies can get an idea of what their salary might be by looking for a similar opening in Colorado. From Amazon.com Inc. to Walmart Inc., firms have hundreds of job postings that disclose hourly and yearly pay ranges thanks to a new state law.
